meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: An Unfamiliar Face Wins the Green Jacket Zach Johnson, a player in his fourth full year on the PGA Tour, outlasted the four-time champion Tiger Woods to win his first Masters in Augusta, Ga. Johnson birdied three of the last six holes for a final-round 69. His one-over-par 289 total tied the highest winning score in Masters history. Woods shot a 72 in the final round and finished tied for second place.
SPORTSMONDAY
Army Deserter Crackdown Army prosecutions of desertion have risen sharply in the last four years, resulting in thousands more negative discharges and prison time, Army records show.
PAGE A10
Keeping the Printers Rolling Hewlett-Packard, which makes most of its profit from its printing unit, is devising ways to get people to print Web pages instead of reading them on-screen.
BUSINESS DAY

Guant치namo Hunger Strike A long-term hunger strike has broken out at the American detention center at Guant치namo Bay, Cuba, with more than a dozen prisoners subjecting themselves to daily force-feeding to protest their treatment, military officials and lawyers for the detainees say.
PAGE A12

Locking Up the Evidence A federal law that says child pornography is so toxic that it must be kept in a secure government facility and cannot be copied raises problems for defense lawyers. ''Sidebar,'' by Adam Liptak.
PAGE A10
New Maestro for Los Angeles Esa-Pekka Salonen, conductor of the Los Angeles Philharmonic, plans to leave in 2009 and will be succeeded by Gustavo Dudamel of Venezuela, a star at 26.
THE ARTS, PAGE E1

Freed Britons Can Sell Stories British officials are letting the sailors and marines freed by Iran sell their stories. Some people want them to explain their actions; others say the move is exploitive.
PAGE A9
Sol LeWitt Is Dead The innovator and master of Conceptual art was 78. His works ranged from spare white sculptures to paintings like ''Form Derived From a Cubic Rectangle,'' above.
PAGE A15
